intro: Elaeoselinum meoides, commonly known as the desert parsley, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its root system is deep, allowing it to access water from lower soil layers. Elaeoselinum meoides is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in native plant gardens.
